newsitem.title: JAPAN: No need to notify overseas authorities on DKB -MOF.
newsitem.headline: No need to notify overseas authorities on DKB -MOF.

text.p: There is no need at the moment to notify overseas authorities of the suspected illegal dealings by Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank and Nomura Securities, Japanese Vice Finance Minister Tadashi Ogawa said on Thursday.
"If we have an opportunity, we will likely explain (to overseas authorities)," Ogawa said.
Asked whether he saw such a need, Ogawa said: "I don't think so at the moment. Rather, we need to make sure that we gather the facts (on the issue)."
Ogawa also declined to comment on the earlier arrest of four DKB officials by Tokyo prosecutors on suspicion of lending 11.78 billion yen to a racketeer.
He said MOF will wait for the outcome of the prosecutors' investigation of DKB as the findings will affect the ministry's expected administrative steps on the bank.
